label: 華
本: State and Diplomacy in Early Modern Japan: Asia in the Development of the Tokugawa Bakufu . Stanford University Press . 1991
説明文: (Ch. hua) (As opposed to i (夷; ch. i), or barbarian; " lit. "flowery") The distinctions (made in the ideological dichotomy of Neoconfucianism) were at the root of the Chinese self-perception, and informed the ordering of China's relations with the outside world in the pre-modern period. "
